channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Ministers consider U-turn on private travel tests
item.description: A ban on travellers using non-NHS coronavirus tests could be scrapped by the Welsh government.

item.title: Drugs: How a county lines gang moved into Newtown
item.description: Joy Jones's quiet cul-de-sac became home to drug dealers and their customers.

item.title: COP26: Climate change summit is 'make or break' for the planet, says MP
item.description: An environmental campaigner turned MP says Wales needs to move faster in transport and energy.

item.title: UK minister rejects call to maintain benefit boost
item.description: The work and pensions secretary rejects a call from UK politicians to maintain a £20 universal credit top up.

item.title: Covid: Doctor blames misinformation for hospital admissions rise
item.description: A critical care consultant says some hospitals were at their busiest for months last weekend.

item.title: Blaenavon man crushed to death under car while stealing part
item.description: Daniel Stephens, 25, needed money for a court case to get access to his children, an inquest heard.

item.title: Injury-hit Wales without host of players for Finland friendly in Helsinki
item.description: Wales will be severely depleted for Wednesday's friendly in Finland after being hit by a spate of withdrawals.

item.title: Mount Everest climber and retired Swansea nurse killed in car crash
item.description: Tributes are paid to John Robertson, who once climbed to Mount Everest's base camp.

item.title: Bangor business park to be sold by Welsh government after 21 years
item.description: £11m has been spent on land at a business park which has been unused since 2000.

item.title: Covid: Teen in hospital with virus urges others to get vaccinated
item.description: Maisy Evans, 17, is in hospital and is so short of breath she can barely talk.

item.title: Leeds complete signing of Wales winger James
item.description: Leeds sign Wales international winger Daniel James from Manchester United, more than two years after he almost joined the club on loan.

item.title: Bute Park attack: Gary Jenkins died from brain injury, inquest hears
item.description: Three people have been charged with the murder of Dr Gary Jenkins after an alleged park attack.

item.title: Drugs: The county lines gang in our Powys cul-de-sac
item.description: What happens when drug dealers move in to a small, rural town?

item.title: Climate change: Meet the people taking action
item.description: A goods swap shop and DIY flood defenders are just some ideas people have put into practice.

item.title: Covid: The doctor busting Covid vaccine myths on social media
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani has been trying to encourage young people on TikTok to get jabbed.

item.title: Rugby: Mixed ability club in Llanelli marks 25 years
item.description: About half of the club's players are registered disabled and most have learning disabilities.

item.title: Stormzy, Skepta and Aitch: Making beats for rap stars at 19
item.description: Chris Rich has made thousands from creating beats in the style of hip hop's elite.

item.title: Payday lenders: 'They are robbing the vulnerable'
item.description: Within months of his first £150 payday loan, Tom owed £6,000 to 10 lenders.

item.title: Dai Greene: Welsh hurdler recalls world gold 10 years on
item.description: Dai Greene admits he is not a man for nostalgia but can make an exception for recalling the 10th anniversary of his 400m hurdles World Championships gold.

item.title: Connor Roberts: Burnley sign Wales defender from Swansea
item.description: Burnley sign Wales international defender Connor Roberts from Swansea for an undisclosed fee.

item.title: Jamal Lowe: Bournemouth sign Swansea City forward for undisclosed fee
item.description: AFC Bournemouth sign Swansea City striker Jamal Lowe for an undisclosed fee on a two-year deal.

item.title: Rhys Williams: Swansea City sign Liverpool defender on loan
item.description: Swansea City sign Liverpool defender Rhys Williams on a season-long loan.

item.title: Michael Obafemi: Swansea City sign Southampton and Republic of Ireland striker
item.description: Swansea City sign striker Michael Obafemi from Southampton for an undisclosed fee thought to be between £1.5m and £2m.

item.title: Llywodraeth Cymru yn ystyried newid rheolau profion teithio
item.description: Ar hyn o bryd mae'n rhaid i deithwyr Cymreig ddefnyddio profion £68 y GIG neu wynebu dirwy o £1,000.

item.title: COP26 yn 'gwbl dyngedfennol' i ddyfodol y blaned
item.description: Gwyddonydd blaenllaw yn dweud bod osgoi newid hinsawdd sylweddol bellach yn "dasg hynod o anodd".

item.title: Meddyg o Fangor yn galw am edrych eto ar reolau Covid
item.description: Dr Nia Hughes yn poeni am y cynnydd mewn achosion ond Llywodraeth Cymru yn dweud eu bod yn cadw golwg.

item.title: Canrif ers geni Raymond Williams
item.description: Yr Athro Daniel Williams sy'n trafod un o feddylwyr mwyaf dylanwadol y chwith

item.title: Canlyniadau nos Fawrth yn y Cymru Premier
item.description: Chwech gêm yn cael eu chwarae nos Fawrth yn y Cymru Premier.
